item.title: Selection of a timestep for SNN simulation
item.dc:creator: Ismael Balafrej
item.description: I recently saw this tweet by Dan Goodman. In a quick experiment, they show that using a large timestep during the simulation of a LIF neuron is detrimental to its behavior. Indeed, the output spiking rate of a LIF neuron with a Poisson spike input decreases when the timestep increases. It already fails at 1 ms, which is somewhat a standard size for timesteps in the CS-oriented community. Even worse, at ms, the neuron doesnâ€™t even spike anymore.
